description_html:
I have often wondered whether a person's type has any bearing on how they lean politically.

This gallery contains images of some politicians, focusing on American Presidents through the years. If the topic interests you, check out David Keirsey's book about Presidential Temperament, which covers this topic in depth!

It can be tricky figuring out what the types are for these people. For some of them, I consulted with one or more friends while going through the Temperament Sorter in David Keirsey's Please Understand Me, and for others I used the type from his book to construct a generic (58%/42%) image.

image_list.title: George Washington
image_list.subtitle_html: 1st President of the USA - Apr. 30, 1789 to Mar. 4, 1797
image_list.story_html: In his book Please Understand Me II, David Keirsey picks George Washington to represent the archetypal ESTJ. The green vertical line in the portrait represents Washington's logical decision-making and the yellow represents his practical and down-to-earth views. This decisiveness and awareness served him well during difficult times, such as those at Valley Forge.

image_list.title: Thomas Jefferson
image_list.subtitle_html: 3rd President of the USA - Mar. 4, 1801 to Mar. 4, 1809
image_list.story_html: David Keirsey identifies Jefferson as an INTP.  The Blue in the portrait represents his Idealism and the Green his Logical decision making.  These characteristics are evident in his interests in topics such as philosophy, science and technology.

image_list.title: Abraham Lincoln
image_list.subtitle_html: 16th President of the USA - Mar. 4, 1861 to Apr. 15, 1865
image_list.story_html: David Keirsey identifies Abraham Lincoln as an INTP. The Blue in the portrait represents his Idealism and the Green his Logical decision making.  His Idealism is evident in his speeches, such as the Gettysburg address and his Logic surely served him well during the time he spent as a lawyer.

image_list.title: George Herbert Walker Bush
image_list.subtitle_html: 41st President of the USA - Jan. 20, 1989 to Jan. 20 1993
image_list.story_html: When I wrote the original version of this program (for grad school in 1988) sometimes we would fill out the Keirsey Temperament Sorter guessing how famous people might answer the questions.  This is a portrait of George H. W. Bush, the 41st president (1989-1993) and father of George W. Bush, the 43rd president.  The Green shows that he is a very Logical person and the Yellow shows that he is very Pragmatic and down-to-earth.

image_list.title: Bill Clinton
image_list.subtitle_html: 42nd President of the USA - Jan. 20, 1993 to Jan. 20, 2001
image_list.story_html: This article at personalitydesk.com claims that Bill Clinton is an ENFP: http://www.personalitydesk.com/enfp-type-description.php .  The Blue represents his Idealistic view and the Red represents his Emotion.  These traits are evident in his enthusiasm, compassion, and love of freedom.

image_list.title: George W. Bush
image_list.subtitle_html: 43rd President of the USA - Jan. 20, 2001 to Jan. 20, 2009
image_list.story_html: This article claims that George W. Bush is an ESTP: http://www.slate.com/id/2184696/ .  It also claims that 'They are a common presidential type: Both Roosevelts, JFK, and LBJ were ESTPs.'  The Yellow in the image represents their down-to-earth Pragmatism, and the Green represents their use of Logic when making decisions.

image_list.title: Barack Obama
image_list.subtitle_html: 44th President of the USA - Jan. 20, 2009 to Jan. 20, 2017
image_list.story_html: This article claims Barack Obama is an ENFP: http://www.slate.com/id/2184696/ , and we believe this is a reasonable and believable assessment.  The Blue in the image represents his Idealism and hope for the future, and the Red represents his Emotion.  Both of these qualities are evident in his support of legislation supporting making health care available to all people.
